item.title: Host Hugo static website on GitHub Pages using Actions and my domain
item.description: In a cost-saving exercise I wanted to try host my personal website on a free platform, since the code repository is hosted on GitHub, I decided to look into GitHub pages.

item.title: Dynamically load fonts
item.description:
I’ve added a Dyslexia accessibility feature to my website which loads a Dyslexia-friendly font, woo!

This involved creating a small toggle function to turn the feature on and off, but when I reload the page it’s gone, so I had it bake a cookie so the function could trigger automatically on-reload. This still wasn’t enough I didn’t want every visitor to load the font, only users who click the toggle button, so I added a section to dynamically load the font.

item.title: Firefox-based browser add-on suggestions
item.description: HTTPS Everywhere [GPLv3+] # Enforces the use of secure connections where known to be possible through the use of an updated white-list, this means where a website has the ability to deliver it’s bits to you over HTTPS(Secure HTTP) the add-on will tell it to. Browsing over a secure connection is intended to prevent third-parties, parties other than you and the server itself, from being capable of peaking into the connection and spying or tampering with the data.
